place.name: EAST HATLEY
place.gazetteerText: HATLEY (East), a parish in Caxton district, Cambridge; adjacent to Beds, 2½ miles SE of Gamlingay r. station, and 7½ NNW of Royston. Post town, Potton, under St. Neots. Acres, 1, 176. Rated property, £653. Pop., 139. Houses, 27. The property is divided among a few. The manor belonged formerly to the Castell family; and belongsnowto Downing College, Cambridge. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Ely. Valne, £175. Patron, Downing College, Cambridge. The church contains monuments of the Castells, and was recently in disrepair. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
